{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3116354,"name":"","username":"nstrike","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/nstrike/{size}/167038_2.png","created_at":"2023-01-04T17:18:22.804Z","cooked":"

Ever had a tough time working on code because a computer isn‚Äôt setup with wpilib tools and you don‚Äôt have admin permissions? You don‚Äôt need it anymore!

You can now compile or modify your robot code (with intelisense!) using github Codespaces. Before we start you should note that there is 60hrs free of 2 core codespaces per month and even if your project is under an organization it will be charged against your account, NOT THE ORGANIZATION. We have made a example of this on our mentor example code on github.

You can delete codespaces after you‚Äôre done with them by going to
Code->Codespaces->On current branch->...->Delete.

To create a codespace you go to
Code->Codespaces->Create codespace on main.

GitHub

Start coding instantly with Codespaces

Spin up fully configured dev environments in the cloud that start in seconds.

Codespaces seem perfect for teams where not all programmers have their own laptops and can install the tools on them. To set it up for an FRC project all you have to do is create the file from the root of the repository .devcontainer/devcontainer.json which contains

{
  "image": "mcr.microsoft.com/devcontainers/universal:2",
  "features": {
  },
  "customizations": {
    "vscode": {
      "extensions": ["wpilibsuite.vscode-wpilib","vscjava.vscode-java-pack","vscjava.vscode-gradle"]
    }
  }
}

As is done here.

Hopefully this helps many teams this season!

BroncBotz3481/FRC2022-MENTOR: BroncBotz 2022 Mentor Code","clicks":22},{"url":"https://github.com/features/codespaces","internal":false,"reflection":false,"title":"GitHub Codespaces ¬∑ GitHub","clicks":13},{"url":"https://www.chiefdelphi.com/t/github-codespaces-programming-in-your-browser-for-frc-2023-update/423814","internal":true,"reflection":true,"title":"Github Codespaces (Programming in your browser for FRC) 2023 Update","clicks":0}],"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":5}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":51887,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"YAGSL & YASS Creator "},"post_url":"/t/programming-on-a-web-browser-chrome-edge-firefox/420681/1","custom_user_title":"YAGSL & YASS Creator ","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":5}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":5,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":3116361,"name":"Vlad B","username":"vladb","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/vladb/{size}/199590_2.png","created_at":"2023-01-04T17:33:17.856Z","cooked":"

Cool stuff! This certainly can also be helpful for students working off of school provided devices, which commonly have draconian limitations (usually on installations, but less so on specific sites). Team 5113 is working on an analogues system (based on the ‚Äúthin client‚Äù archetype), hoping to report back soon!

Does the image you use support viewing the sim gui?

Gitpod has a similar number of free hours and one of their base images comes with automatic browser based vnc if a gui is launched. Using a similar image on codespaces would be invaluable.

Vasista:

Gitpod has a similar number of free hours and one of their base images comes with automatic browser based vnc if a gui is launched.

VSCode itself implements something similar for viewing the UI, so should be entirely possible vscode/.devcontainer at main ¬∑ microsoft/vscode ¬∑ GitHub

Regarding the plugin installation, I‚Äôve heard that having the WPILib plugin live in the plugin store may or may not continue (@Thad_House ?). If its not available, this may require some changes here in the near future, and maybe a simple docker container.

nstrike:
  "customizations": {
    "vscode": {
      "extensions": ["wpilibsuite.vscode-wpilib","vscjava.vscode-java-pack","vscjava.vscode-gradle"]
    }

Will_Toth:

Regarding the plugin installation, I‚Äôve heard that having the WPILib plugin live in the plugin store may or may not continue

We publish it to the store just so someone else doesn‚Äôt publish an unofficial version with the same name. We don‚Äôt monitor or maintain the store version because we recommend teams use the WPILib installer‚Äôs version of VS Code instead. We do that because the installer must modify the VS Code install to make intellisense work. In other words, using a vanilla install of VS Code with the store plugin is broken due to Gradle-isms.

Out of curiosity, and sorry for pulling the thread slightly of topic, what kind of of modifications does it do to the VS Code installation itself? I looked in the installer repo but am not familiar with the layout. (You meant the Avalonia installer, not the plugin, right?)

EDIT: I found this, so it looks like it‚Äôs specifically things in the user settings file?

","post_number":6,"post_type":1,"posts_count":16,"updated_at":"2023-01-04T18:26:03.784Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":5,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":148,"readers_count":147,"score":34.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":420681,"topic_slug":"programming-on-a-web-browser-chrome-edge-firefox","display_username":"Matt Soucy (he/him)","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://github.com/wpilibsuite/WPILibInstaller-Avalonia/blob/main/WPILibInstaller-Avalonia/ViewModels/InstallPageViewModel.cs#L262","internal":false,"reflection":false,"title":"WPILibInstaller-Avalonia/InstallPageViewModel.cs at main ¬∑ wpilibsuite/WPILibInstaller-Avalonia ¬∑ GitHub","clicks":3}],"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":16846,"username":"calcmogul","name":"Tyler Veness","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/calcmogul/{size}/128045_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":11822,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"166 Chop Shop (Software Mentor)"},"post_url":"/t/programming-on-a-web-browser-chrome-edge-firefox/420681/6","custom_user_title":"166 Chop Shop (Software Mentor)","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3116394,"name":"Peter Johnson","username":"Peter_Johnson","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/peter_johnson/{size}/10417_2.png","created_at":"2023-01-04T18:28:43.360Z","cooked":"

Correct. You can find this in a local install in C:\Users\Public\wpilib\2023\vscode\data\user-data\User\settings.json. What this does is:

  • Set java.home, JAVA_HOME, and PATH to point to our installed JDK
  • Disable auto-updates
  • Disable system certificates

Vasista:

Does the image you use support viewing the sim gui?

It seams to be done with whole desktop interface here which uses NoVNC to show it to the user. Probably something can be implemented for FIRST based applications as well.

calcmogul:

In other words, using a vanilla install of VS Code with the store plugin is broken due to Gradle-isms.

Interesting. Our team, has used both the installer version and a normally installed version with a current version VSIX from the GitHub project. We didn‚Äôt notice a significant difference, but maybe we weren‚Äôt looking hard enough. Is there a list of changes made to the basic VSCode that we can see?

calcmogul:

We do that because the installer must modify the VS Code install to make intellisense work. In other words, using a vanilla install of VS Code with the store plugin is broken due to Gradle-isms.

Seems odd that this would be enough (especially because the JDK is just temurin11), are those changes the only ones necessary to get InteliSense working and fix the aforementioned ‚ÄúGradle-isms‚Äù?

There‚Äôs nothing related to IntelliSense needed for a vanilla install vs the wpilib install, other then the forced jdk, which sometimes can break IntelliSense.

The primary reason is to force a known good jdk, as well as disable updates and disable system certs as said above.

Forcing a known good jdk was very important the first year, and is still important as invalid jdk versions (both too high and too low) can break builds.

Disabling updates is important because there have been cases in the past where vscode updates have broken the extension, which is hard to debug, and really annoying on our end.

The certificate thing is probably not as necessary anymore, it was added a few years back when sites were changing tls versions and that broke things.

These things, plus the local maven cache are the main reasons we really recommend the installer. It limits the amount of configurations we need to support.

Github Codespaces (Programming in your browser for FRC) 2023 Update Programming
I made a post a few weeks ago pre-kick off on how to use codespaces for WPILib, the marketplace plugin hasn‚Äôt been updated since last year (because we are not supposed to be using it). So here is a new devcontainer.json which allows you to use 2023.2.1 wpilib on codespaces. Remember this goes into .devcontainer/devcontainer.json. { "image": "mcr.microsoft.com/devcontainers/universal:2", "postCreateCommand": "cd /opt && wget 'https://github.com/wpilibsuite/vscode-wpilib/releases/download/v20‚Ä¶
